p: The production of different hydrolytic enzymes by endophytic microbes indirectly promotes plant growth and protects from phytopathogens [ 47]. In this study, all tested bacterial endophytes obtained from P. incisa produced xylanase, cellulase, and catalase, while four bacterial isolates (57% of tested strains) produced amylase, six bacterial strains (85.7% of tested strains) were found to be potent protease producers, and five bacterial isolates (71% of tested strains) showed chitinase activity.
